content.raw:
drcsim 2.0 will publish head link states inside a [sensor_msgs/Imu](http://ros.org/doc/api/sensor_msgs/html/msg/Imu.html) message under `/multisense_sl/imu` topic, albeit it now needs an additional patch correctly situate the imu according to spec.

To the best of our knowledge, according to CRL,

Gyro and Accelerometer Mounting Locations:

  * There are two IMU components.  A gyro and an accelerometer/magnetometer.
  * The gyro is mounted immediately behind the right imager, and about 0.5cm below the imager’s center point with X-right, Y-down, Z-forward.
  * The accelerometer is mounted about 2cm inboard of the gyro, with X-down, Y-left, Z-forward, but its axes are remapped in software to match those of the gyro.


Here are links to datasheets on the IMU components we’re using:

 * [Gyroscope: ST L3G4200D](http://www.st.com/jp/analog/product/250373.jsp)
 * [Accelerometer/Magnetometer: ST LSM303DLHC](http://www.st.com/internet/analog/product/251940.jsp)

Expected Future API:

 * Each of these has configurable data rate and sensor scaling.  These configurations will be exposed through the MultiSense-SL API, but we will not support data rates over 100Hz.
 * Note that the two sensors have their own free-running internal clocks, so even if the user requests the sensors to run at the same update rate, they will not be synchronized.  For each sensor, the MultiSense-SL simply parses the sensor data, bundles it up with a timestamp, and passes it to the user.
